Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  REV. FATHER EVANGELOS, Greek Orthodox Archdioces, 8-10 East 79th Street, New York,NY  10021.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by THE SPEAKER (COUNCIL MEMBER VALLONE).
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Father Evangelos, Greek Orthodox Archdiocese, 8-10 East 79th Street, New York, N.Y. 10021.

The Speaker (Council Member Vallone) moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 5, 2001 and June 28, 2001 be adopted and printed by Council Member Nelson.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Nelson moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  June 5, 2001and June 28, 2001 be adopted and printed.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Dyker Heights Boulevard, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Dyker Heights Boulevard, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution commending Rodolfo Montiel, Teodoro Cabrera and other members of the Organization of Campesino Ecologists of the Sierra de Petaltlan and Coyuca de Catalan for their courageous struggle to protect the forests of Mexico in the southern state of Guerrero, condemning the arrests of Rodolfo Montiel and Teodoro Cabrera, condemning the violent actions of the 40th Infantry Battalion and calling upon the Attorney General of Mexico to investigate the actions of the individual soldiers involved as recommended by Mexico's National Commission for Human Rights of August 2000, and calling for the immediate and unconditional release of Rodolfo Montiel and Teodoro Cabrera and the payment of compensation by the Mexican government for their arrest and prosecution.
Items.MatterName: Commending Rodolfo Montiel and Teodoro Cabrera

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Public Safety

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring the police department of the city of New York to submit certain information to the City Council and to adhere to certain reporting requirements.
Items.MatterName: Requiring Police Dept to submit information to adhere to certain reporting requirements.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York, the Mayor of the City of New York and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority ("MTA") to take all necessary steps to obtain a Certificate of Interim Trail Use from the United States Surface Transportation Board ("STB") in connection with "railbanking" the elevated railroad viaduct running from 75-95 Gansevoort Street through 547-55 West 34th Street, Manhattan (commonly referred to as the "High Line").
Items.MatterName: MTA, Railbanking

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.7594, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Kwong T. Chan, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 7402, Lot No. 44 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Brooklyn (A.7594)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Rhodd Cummings, A.5543, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner George Pullin, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Queens (A.5543)

Items.Title: General Order Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1439, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.771, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction of the city of New York ".
Items.MatterName: Designation of deputy warden (S.1439, A.771)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the term of a plumbing or fire suppression piping contractor license and the renewal period to two years, requiring continuing education for a licensed master plumber and licensed fire suppression piping contractor to renew their license, expanding the scope of minor plumbing work that may be performed by unlicensed individuals and changing certain permitting practices.
Items.MatterName: Extending renewal period for a plumbing license.

Introduction and Reading of Bills

General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to a park name, Peter Chahales Park, Borough of Queens.                     .
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Peter Chahales Park, Queens

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to providing an exemption to the application of residency requirements when an exempted employee would lose the exemption as a result of a change in title.
Items.MatterName: Residency Requirements

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of fire sprinklers in certain below grade mercantile spaces.
Items.MatterName: Installation of fire sprinklers in certain below grade mercantile spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the duties of assessors in assessing real property.
Items.MatterName: Duties of assessors in assessing real property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse and children of deceased city employees.
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for surviving spouse and children of deceased city employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Election Law to clarify and codify the State's long-standing practice of placing voting machines in certain nursing homes, residential health care facilities and other similar residences where disabled and elderly voters live, many of whom are unable to travel to poll sites without great difficulty and further calling upon the United States Department of Justice to deny pre-clearance and/or otherwise prohibit the removal of the voting machines from these residential health care facilities.
Items.MatterName: Voting Machines, Nursing Homes

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to enact legislation to regulate staffing and training standards in nursing homes in New York State.
Items.MatterName: Nursing Homes, Regulate Staffing and Training

Items.Title: Resolution opposing the decision by Federal regulators to extend the deadline for financial institutions to comply with the privacy provisions required under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act of 1999, and urging them to require financial institutions to inform consumers of their privacy rights in clear, conspicuous, and understandable language.
Items.MatterName: Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act of 1999

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a plaza name, Chief Charles A. Joshua Plaza, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Chief Charles A. Joshua Plaza, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council of the City of New York to declare the months of July and August to be Water Safety/Drowning Prevention Awareness Months.
Items.MatterName: Water Safety/Drowning Prevention Awareness Months, July and August

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to adopt S. 1691-a and the Governor to subsequently sign such bill and its companion Assembly bill A. 734-a, legislation which would enable disabled workers to "buy-in" to the Medicaid program.
Items.MatterName: Enable disabled workers to buy-in to the Medicaid program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to adopt and the President to enact legislation which would promote greater parity in the provision of mental health services.
Items.MatterName: Greater parity in the provision of mental health services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to education and training for public assistance recipients.
Items.MatterName: Education and Training for Public Assistance Recipients

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the decision of Attorney General John Ashcroft to issue a formal legal opinion through the United States Department of Justice, that the Second Amendment automatically guarantees the right to private gun ownership, reversing the Department's position of the last 30 years.
Items.MatterName: Gun Ownership

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing promoters.
Items.MatterName: Licensing promoters

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to conduct an oversight hearing regarding the possible correlation between the increasing drop-out rate among New York City high school students and the newly instituted Regents requirements for graduation from high school.
Items.MatterName: New York City High School Students, Drop-out Rate

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Board of Education and New York State agencies to expedite their efforts to reduce emissions from diesel fuel school buses and to purchase new alternative fuel vehicles as quickly as possible to safeguard the health of our schoolchildren.
Items.MatterName: Diesel Fuel School Buses, Reduce Emissions

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for violations of the littering law.
Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for violations of the littering law.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the Rent Guidelines Board for once again needlessly increasing rents to New York City residents of rent stabilized buildings by an egregious 4% for 1-year lease renewals and 6% for 2-year lease renewals, instead of the anticipated 3% and 5%, respectively, that would have more than sufficiently covered building owner expenses and the costs of inflation, and calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to hold hearings and review the process by which the Rent Guidelines Board makes its decisions.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the Rent Guidelines Board

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Rev. David M. Cory Place, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Rev. David M. Cory Place, Brooklyn

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.7594, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Kwong T. Chan, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 7402, Lot No. 44 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Brooklyn (A.7594)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to conduct a hearing to assess what actions the New York Public Library, the Brooklyn Public Library and the Queens Borough Public Library are taking to move toward compliance with the federal Children's Internet Protection Act (CIPA).
Items.MatterName: Public Library, Children's Internet Protection Act (CIPA)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct a hearing on the latest state-of-the-art Internet filtering software technology.
Items.MatterName: Internet filtering software technology.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Consumer Product Safety Commission ("CPSC") to issue a ruling requiring all non-wood baseball bats (aluminum, composite and graphite) to perform like wood bats to protect consumers from the unreasonable danger and risk of injury posed by these higher-performing non-wood bats, and to recall all non-wood baseball bats that exceed the performance of wood baseball bats.
Items.MatterName: Non-wood baseball bats

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing regarding allegations of sexual and racial harassment of women participating in the Work Experience Program.
Items.MatterName: Allegations of sexual and racial harassment of women participating in WEP

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the week of August 1st to August 7th as World Breastfeeding Week.
Items.MatterName: World Breastfeeding Week, August 1-7, 2001

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the United Nations World Conference Against Racism, Racial Discrimination, Xenophobia and Related Intolerance and the Proposed United Nations Dakar Declaration and urging the United States to support the same.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Supporting the United Nations World Conference Against Racism

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tem (Council Member Spigner) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The President Pro Tem (Council Member Spigner) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: LU 1118 & Res 2026; LU 1119 & Res 2027, LU 1120 & Res 2028, LU 1121 & Res  2029, LU 1122 & Res 2030; LU 1131 & Res 2021; and Res 1747.  See files for individual votes.
